p: Richness and diversity may in part have increased as the incidence of invasive species increased by 108%, as summer senescence intensified, which is consistent with observations that grassland invasives increase with drying conditions [ 86]. Increasing invasives had no effect on NBR ANPP (P < 0.28), and thereby, would have little effect on summer senescence measures, as > 50% of invasives were annual brome grasses, which provide very little biomass (cheatgrass, Bromus tectorum, accounted for less than 3% of the invasive bromes). Average plant drought resistance increased by 35.8% over our study, which is largely due to the increase in wheatgrasses and decrease in bluegrasses. Fire tolerance was unchanged over our study.
